author: 小浪财讯
title: 科创医药ETF（588860）跌1.56%，半日成交额1370.98万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，科创医药ETF（588860）跌1.56%，报1.326元，成交额1370.98万元。科创医药ETF（588860）重仓股方面， 联影医疗 截止午盘涨0.26%， 百济神州 跌1.21%， 惠泰医疗 跌0.54%， 艾力斯 跌1.84%， 百利天恒 跌1.44%， 泽璟制药 跌0.57%， 华大智造 跌2.32%， 君实生物 跌2.37%， 爱博医疗 跌0.62%， 特宝生物 跌0.30%。
科创医药ETF（588860）业绩比较基准为 上证科创板生物医药指数 收益率，管理人为工银瑞信基金管理有限公司，基金经理为史宝珖，成立（2024-08-08）以来回报为34.04%，近一个月回报为6.61%。
风险提示：市场有风险，投资需谨慎。本文为AI大模型自动发布，任何在本文出现的信息（包括但不限于个股、评论、预测、图表、指标、理论、任何形式的表述等）均只作为参考，不构成个人投资建议。

author: 责编：秦耳
title: 马斯克旗下xAI联合创始人伊戈尔·巴布什金离职，将投身AI安全风投领域
text:
4Nu9aopJHqK tech.huanqiu.com article 马斯克旗下xAI联合创始人伊戈尔·巴布什金离职，将投身AI安全风投领域 /e3pmh164r/e3pmtmdvg 【环球网科技综合报道】8月14日消息，硅谷人工智能领域再添人事变动：马斯克旗下xAI初创公司的联合创始人伊戈尔·巴布什金（Igor Babuschkin）在社交平台上正式宣布离职，结束其自2023年7月公司创立以来的核心领导角色。
据悉，作为xAI工程团队的灵魂人物，巴布什金曾主导该公司技术架构搭建与超级计算集群建设，助力xAI在短短两年内跻身全球AI模型开发第一梯队。
巴布什金透露，未来将创立风险投资公司Babuschkin Ventures，专注于支持AI安全研究及“推动人类进步、解锁宇宙奥秘”的初创企业。
马斯克在社交平台回应称：“感谢伊戈尔为xAI奠定的基础！没有他，我们无法取得今天的成就。”据内部人士透露，xAI已启动全球人才招募计划，重点补充AI安全与多模态模型领域的专家。（青山）

author: /author/ians/
title: Heavy snow forecast for northern, eastern Japan
text:
Heavy snow forecast for northern, eastern Japan
By [IANS](/author/ians/) | Published: January 3, 2025 05:24 PM2025-01-03T17:24:56+5:302025-01-03T17:25:12+5:30
Tokyo, Jan 3 Heavy snow is expected to hit northern and eastern Japan through Saturday, mainly in mountainous ...
Tokyo, Jan 3 Heavy snow is expected to hit northern and eastern Japan through Saturday, mainly in mountainous areas along the Sea of Japan coast, due to a winter pressure pattern and a cold air mass, the country's weather agency said Friday.
As of 5 am local time Friday, 412 centimetres of snow had accumulated in Sukayu in the Hakkoda mountain range in Aomori Prefecture, more than double the average amount, according to the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA).
The estimated 24-hour snowfall through Saturday morning is expected to be up to 50 centimetres in the Tohoku region, 40 centimetres in the Hokkaido and Niigata prefectures, 35 centimetres in the Kanto-Koshin region and 30 centimetres in the Hokuriku and Tokai regions, said the JMA.
Weather officials called on people to prepare for traffic disruptions, while urging caution against snow that accumulates on power cables and trees, as well as avalanches in snow-covered areas, Xinhua news agency reported.
Winds could intensify along the Sea of Japan coast from northern to western Japan through Sunday, with possible blizzards in some areas, the JMA added.
Heavy snow had blanketed northern Japan on Tuesday, forcing dozens of flight cancellations as many people were traveling for the New Year holidays.
Japan Airlines said it canceled 42 flights to and from the northernmost island of Hokkaido, affecting 6,398 passengers, while All Nippon Airways scrapped 14 flights, affecting 800 passengers.
According to the JMA, heavy snowfall fell in many places in central and northern Hokkaido on Tuesday due to a winter pressure pattern.
Earlier, the average temperature across Japan from September to November in 2024 was the highest since records began in 1898.
The nationwide autumn average was 1.97 degrees Celsius above the normal baseline, breaking the previous record set last year by a significant margin of 0.58 degrees, the data showed.
The JMA had attributed the record-breaking warmth to the effects of global warming and a northward shift in the jet stream, which allowed warm southern air to dominate.
Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor

author: mobile@rds.ca ()
title: Samsonov et une tempête ne peuvent freiner les Wings
text:
Arrivés tardivement à Toronto, les Red Wings volent le match
Andrew Copp a trouvé le fond du filet avec 1:40 à faire au match pour donner une victoire de 4-2 aux Red Wings de Detroit sur les Maple Leafs de Toronto, dimanche.
Les Wings, qui sont arrivés à Toronto tout juste avant la partie, ont comblé un retard de deux buts pour s'imposer au final.
Dylan Larkin a permis aux Wings de s'inscrire au tableau une première fois avant de voir Daniel Sprong déculotter en échappée le gardien Ilya Samsonov au début de la troisième période pour créer l'égalité 2-2.
Le gardien
James Reimer a su tirer son épingle du jeu contre son ancienne équipe pour signer la victoire. Il a fait face à 31 lancers. Lucas Raymond a complété avec un but dans un filet désert.
La partie, qui devait être initialement présentée à 19 heures, a été reportée de plus d'une trentaine de minutes parce que Detroit n'a pas été en mesure de rejoindre Toronto samedi en raison d'un ennui mécanique de son avion en plus de subir les affres d'une tempête de neige dimanche, si bien que les joueurs des Red Wings sont arrivés à l'aréna qu'environ 90 minutes avant le début de la rencontre.
Les Red Wings ont perdu les services du vétéran attaquant Patrick Kane, qui est tombé au combat à la suite d'une blessure au bas du corps. Avant de quitter la rencontre, Kane avait été solidement mis en échec par
Pontus Holmberg. Dans les secondes suivantes, Kane a aussi fait une mauvaise chute près de son filet.
Mitch Marner, suite à un bel échange de passes, a inscrit son nom dans le livre d'histoire des Maple Leafs quand il a marqué son 18e de la saison, ce qui lui a permis de devenir le joueur le plus rapide à atteindre les 600 points. Il a réussi l'exploit à son 548e match alors que Darryl Sittler avait eu besoin de 584 parties pour le faire.
Marner est aussi le septième joueur des Maple Leafs à atteindre ce plateau. Son but donnait une avance de deux buts aux siens.
Holmberg avait ouvert la marque pour Toronto en faisant dévier la rondelle à la 32e seconde de la deuxième période pour son deuxième de la saison.
Samsonov a affronté 23 tirs devant la cage des Maple Leafs, qui encaissent un troisième revers de suite. Il était de retour devant le filet des Leafs après avoir été cédé au ballottage et envoyé dans la Ligue américaine.

author: divyastuti
title: Survey Discovers New Reptile and Amphibian Species – GKToday
text: Survey Discovers New Reptile and Amphibian Species A survey of reptiles and amphibians, known as herpetofauna, was conducted in the Mudumalai Tiger Reserve (MTR), specifically in the Masinagudi Division, from September 7th to 9th, 2024. This survey discovered a large variety of species, with a total of 33 reptiles and 36 amphibians identified. Four of these species might even be completely new to science. Survey Overview The survey covered areas at different heights, ranging from 300 to 2,000 meters above sea level, across different types of habitats. It was led by Deputy Director Arun Kumar P., with guidance from Field Director D. Venkatesh. This was the first full study of herpetofauna in this part of the reserve, which made the findings even more exciting. Potential New Species Four new species were potentially discovered during the survey: - Two geckos: one from the Cnemaspis genus and another from the Hemidactylus genus. - One skink (a type of lizard). - One frog from the Sphaerotheca genus. These species will need more research to be officially confirmed as new, including taxonomic and molecular studies. This means scientists will need to analyze the collected specimens’ physical features and genetic material. Endangered Species The survey also found several endangered species, such as: - The cave dancing frog (Micrixalus spelunca). - Indraneil’s night frog (Nyctibatrachus indraneili). Other important species, like the striped coral snake (Calliophis nigrescens), the king cobra (Ophiophagus hannah), and the Nilgiri burrowing snake (Plectrurus perrotetii), were also observed. These species are either endangered or unique to the area, making their presence important for conservation. Ecological Importance The Masinagudi Division in the Mudumalai Tiger Reserve is ecologically important because it includes a mix of forests and shrub jungles, creating a perfect environment for many different species. The area’s geography makes it a hotspot for biodiversity, meaning it supports a wide variety of plant and animal life. It’s also a key source of water for local wildlife and nearby human communities. More surveys are planned, especially during the upcoming monsoon season, to explore areas that are harder to reach and to focus on species that are active during dry periods. These future efforts will likely uncover even more species, adding to the understanding of the region’s wildlife. Conservation Implications The findings from this survey are very important for protecting the [wildlife](https://www.gktoday.in/2024-world-wildlife-crime-report/) in the area. With this new information, conservationists can develop better plans to manage the reserve and protect these species. Including previous studies, there are now 55 documented reptile species and 39 amphibian species in MTR, with around 40% being unique to the Western Ghats, a biodiversity hotspot. Additionally, 16 species found in the reserve are considered threatened, emphasizing the need for continued conservation efforts. Month: [Current Affairs - October, 2024](https://www.gktoday.in/current-affairs/month/current-affairs-october-2024/) Category: [Science & Technology Current Affairs](https://www.gktoday.in/current-affairs/science-technology-current-affairs/)
